net.davidtanzer.jobjectformatter.formatter

Class AbstractObjectStringFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.davidtanzer.jobjectformatter.formatter.AbstractObjectStringFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectStringFormatter
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfigurableObjectStringFormatter, JsonObjectStringFormatter, SimpleFormatter

    public abstract class AbstractObjectStringFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
implements ObjectStringFormatter
    Abstract base class for implementing your own ObjectStringFormatters. AbstractObjectStringFormatter functionality (extracted from the tests by agiledox):
    • Calls startFormattedString at the beginning of processing.
    • Passes the original values info object to startFormattedString.
    • Calls endFormattedString after processing everything in objectValuesInfo.
    • Calls startValueGroup for every value group in the object info when value grouping is enabled.
    • Calls endValueGroup after every value group in the object when value grouping is enabled.
    • Calls appendSingleValue for every value from the object values info.
    • Adds to string value for simple property.
    • Adds formatted property value for transitive property.
    See Also:
    ObjectValuesInfo, GroupedValuesInfo, ValueInfo

    • Method Detail

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(ObjectValuesInfo info)
        Processes all the information in the ObjectValuesInfo and calls protected methods to do the actual formatting. This method does the heavy lifting of processing the ObjectValuesInfo in the correct order. You normally won't have to override this method, as it calls some protected methods in the correct order. You only have to override those protected methods.
        Specified by:
        format in interface ObjectStringFormatter
        Parameters:
        info - The ObjectValuesInfo that contains all relevant information about the object to format.
        Returns:
        The formatted representation of the object, as String.

      • startFormattedString

        protected void startFormattedString(java.lang.StringBuilder result,
                                    ObjectValuesInfo info)
        The abstract formatter calls this method before it does any processing (Override to define the start of the formatted string).
        Parameters:
        result - The string builder where the formatter collects the formatted string.
        info - All compiled information about the object to be formatted.
        See Also:
        ObjectValuesInfo

      • startValueGroup

        protected void startValueGroup(java.lang.StringBuilder result,
                               GroupedValuesInfo groupedValuesInfo)
        The abstract formatter calls this method before processing any value group (When value grouping is enabled; Override to define the start of a value group in the formatted string).
        Parameters:
        result - The string builder where the formatter collects the formatted string.
        groupedValuesInfo - Information about the value group the formatter is starting.
        See Also:
        GroupedValuesInfo

      • endValueGroup

        protected void endValueGroup(java.lang.StringBuilder result)
        The abstract formatter calls this method after processing any value group (When value grouping is enabled; Override to define the start of a value group in the formatted string).
        Parameters:
        result - The string builder where the formatter collects the formatted string.

      • appendSingleValue

        protected abstract void appendSingleValue(java.lang.StringBuilder result,
                                          ValueInfo value)
        The abstract formatter calls this method for every value that should be added to the result. In this method, you should add the value to the result (with the correct formatting). An implementation could be as simple as this: 
         @Override
protected void appendSingleValue(final StringBuilder result, final ValueInfo value) {
    result.append(value.getPropertyName()).append("=").append(value.getValue());
}
        Parameters:
        result - The string builder where the formatter collects the formatted string.
        value - Information about the value that should be added to the result.

      • getValueSeparator

        protected java.lang.String getValueSeparator()
        Get the separator that the formatter will print between two values.
        Returns:
        The string to separate two values

      • getGroupsSeparator

        protected java.lang.String getGroupsSeparator()
        Get the separator that the formatter will print between two value groups.
        Returns:
        The string to separate two value groups
